summary: Email chain between FBI personnel and attorneys regarding the coordination of a meeting for victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss the distribution of invitations to victims and attorneys, confirming receipt, and addressing missing invitations.

persons.name: Robert
persons.context: Addressed by FBI personnel regarding the receipt of email invitations for a victim meeting and representing several additional victims who did not receive invitations.

events.title: FBI Meeting Coordination for Epstein Victims
events.description: Email correspondence regarding the organization and invitation process for a meeting between the FBI and victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The FBI was organizing a meeting specifically for victims of Jeffrey Epstein in October 2019.
Invitations were sent to victims via their attorneys, and the FBI was following up to confirm receipt and address any missing invitations.
The correspondence indicates coordination between the FBI's New York Field Office and legal representatives of Epstein's victims.
